html: 10.6.17  10:10 pm   If everyone hates pop music, then why is it pop? Reminds of that Yogi Berra quote, "nobody goes there anymore, it's too crowded".

10.6.17  9:54 pm   10.6.17  6:18 pm   Not to be argumentative or anything... you obviously know your situation better than I do... but maybe people want to work with you because they really dig what you're doing, and not because they just want to get publicity out of it? Although, I'm sure you get things on both sides of the spectrum with this. The whole "collab" thing has become very fake, like 2 people pretending to be friends, who really don't know each other at all, doing a video together only because their managers or promoters or whoever arranged it for them. Then they'll beat the dead horse of doing some kind of 'challenge vid' or some other over-done concept just for the sake of advertising eachother's channels to the other person's fan base... I'm not saying I think you should feel pressured or obligated to collaborate with other people or anything like that, but maybe it's kind of an over-generalizatio n to say that other people are only interested in working with you for publicity's sake?

     Like, man, if I lived in NY I'd be emailing you all the time to try to convince you to get together and jam with me hahaha... I wouldn't want it to be recorded or put up on the internet. I'd just love to play music with you.

10.6.17  6:18 pm   Hi Bill. I don't really understand what you mean when you say things like "i sort of had an infinite world of musical and artistic vision going on, which no one else seemed to relate to. it seems there were infinite things i wanted to figure out and create. and i was always extremely disappointed that no one seemed capable or willing to go on this journey with me"... Maybe that was the case when you were younger, or maybe even with people you've met or talked to face to face... But, you have so many huge fans (like millions of people probably) of the stuff you make, and judging by this question page, so many artists/musicians/writers who view you as a major influence and inspiration (myself included). So, I am confused why you think that people don't relate to what you're doing, or that people wouldn't love to go on your journey with you.

10.6.17  5:59 pm   How do award shows work? Like, when you were invited to the shorty awards, did they tell you beforehand that you were going to win?

10.6.17  4:49 pm   I can relate to what you are saying... But I can compromise. People will not be the way you want them too, all the time, along with your dreams and vision. It can be very revealing to be close with people that you share (apparently) little things with, in my experience, and my feelings and constant wanting for people to come aboard and sail on my artistic boat (or boat fleet) slowly started to become not so meaningful. I'm a full time musician and one of my best and closest friends is a physics doctor; my girlfriend is an actress. It is all so wonderful. Please don't miss out and don't be afraid. (I'm not the one you responded to in 10.6.17  4:59 am , btw).

10.6.17  3:04 pm   complex question. anything, any action, requires time to manifest.

      doing anything, making anything, becoming anything -- these all are possible because of movement thru the 4th dimension. and as you move thru time, you change, to the point where the same person seconds apart is not really the same person but two ridiculously similar individuals. but how about thoughts? do those require time to exist ?

      suppose time were to stop altogether -- would individuals be locked into one thought or state of mind for eternity, or would those thoughts cease to exist because they, like any action, require time to generate? thoughts can sometimes be full sentences... would you get locked into the sentence or a part of the sentence? just gimme yo thoughts wurtzman this is confusing me
